body: Could be closed.

Is the save button in the gray toolbar more friendly
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55787491/91389041-1c2bd200-e86b-11ea-800b-4cb71aef8124.png)
@yangyichao-mango Please solve the above problem，Thanks

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3021207/91400040-99f2dc00-e871-11ea-896f-2b9bb8750363.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3021207/91400059-a1b28080-e871-11ea-8c26-5f01dacd834b.png)

The log show that each master server execute this command one times, I think maybe some bug exists in ZK lock.

> Is the save button in the gray toolbar more friendly

after click `save` ,user have to config something before click `add` 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3156608/91408165-f7892780-e875-11ea-888e-1d837be414bb.png)

You add this graying out for the work that is already online. The backend of the online workflow is checked. If you are only for the online workflow, you can prevent the user from clicking the save button and restrict the user from adding it. Can’t add some changes

> You add this graying out for the work that is already online. The backend of the online workflow is checked. If you are only for the online workflow, you can prevent the user from clicking the save button and restrict the user from adding it. Can’t add some changes

but if disabled the `save` button , i can't check the config[tenant,alert,timeout]info in the popout dialog,
so I just graying out the `add` button to avoid unnecessary click

> but if disabled the `save` button , i can't check the config[tenant,alert,timeout]info in the popout dialog,
> so I just graying out the `add` button to avoid unnecessary click

If the user needs to see the configuration information inside, it is also possible
who can check the reason?

![xxxx](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18161585/91427398-6c695b00-e890-11ea-8c4f-7194e91c4123.png)

Batch activate Users
request URL：
POST /users/batch/activate http1.0/1.1

Content-Type application/json
post parameters (input user names)
 [ "123",
 "124",
 "12345",
 "2345"
 ]


response
 {
 "code": 0,
 "data": {
 "success": [
 "123",
 "124",
 "1235"
 ],
 "failed": [
 "2345"
 ]
 },
 "msg":"activate success number is 3, failed number is 1"
 }
I'll try to reproduce it

just like airflow, wirte task run log to local disk produce many small file,
but airflow  produce plugin to 
write log to remote file system like s3,
or read log from remote (like es), but you need use logstash to collect task logs,and clean the log after collected. 

---

ds can add some pr to read log from remote log server

this is the airflow Writing Logs we can reference
* Writing Logs Locally
* Writing Logs to Amazon S3
* Writing Logs to Azure Blob Storage
* Writing Logs to Google Cloud Storage
* Writing Logs to Elasticsearch
* Writing Logs to Elasticsearch over TLS

Add a status check function after start and stop script execution. If status check fails, you will get feedback immediately.

please resolve conflicts

good news, seems it not a bug of DolphinScheduler, the entire process as follows:

The insert command inserted into the master, but it may be read from the master or slave when reading. It may be that first time the master reads the data on the master , it will be executed, and then the command will be removed from the master, and the second loop will be read from the slave. However, due to the delay of master-slave synchronization, the command in the slave is not deleted, so it is executed again

---
就是插入command是插入到master了，但是读的时候可能会从master或者slave读，那可能第一次读了master发现有数据就执行了，然后从master中移除command，第二次循环就从slave读了，但是由于主从同步延时，所以这时候slave里面的这条command并没有被删除，所以又执行了一次
if you meet this situation, to database, you can set force reading from master
thanks

1.You need to offline the workflow before you can edit the workflow information
2.The worker group is the first one by default, you can create a new workflow to check whether the worker group default values are correct
3.The console checks which is the first worker group returned by the /worker-group/all-groups interface

我不是要编辑作业，只是想手动执行作业。
但是执行作业时不能选择工作组，必须先下线工作流再执行才能选择工作组，这显然是不合理。
最重要的是，执行作业时默认的那个工作组，不是我为这个作业配置的那个。
I don‘t want to edit the job, I'm just want to execute it manually.
However, when executing a job, I can't select a workgroup. I must offline the workflow before I can select a workgroup. This is obviously unreasonable.
The most important thing is that the default workgroup when executing the job is not the one I configured for this job.

There can be multiple tasks under a workflow, and each task can be configured with different worker groups. In this case, how can the default worker grouping during workflow execution be consistent with the tasks?
一个工作流下面可以有多个任务，每个任务可以配置不同的worker分组，那这种情况下，工作流执行时的默认worker分组怎么保持和任务一致呢

> There can be multiple tasks under a workflow, and each task can be configured with different worker groups. In this case, how can the default worker grouping during workflow execution be consistent with the tasks?
> 一个工作流下面可以有多个任务，每个任务可以配置不同的worker分组，那这种情况下，工作流执行时的默认worker分组怎么保持和任务一致呢

我明白了，执行时候不管选择哪个工作组，最终都会被作业实际配置的那个工作组执行。谢谢您的解答。
 I understand, no matter which workgroup is selected when executing, it will be executed by the workgroup configured by the job.
Thank you for your answer.

The failure strategy is for parallel tasks，For example：
1. task A and task B are in parallel, task C and task A are in series, and task D and task B are in series.
2. After task A fails, task C will fail, but tasks B and D can continue to execute
失败策略是针对并行任务的，例如：
1.任务A和任务B是并行关系，任务C和任务A是串联，任务D和任务B是串联关系
2.任务A失败后，任务C会失败，但任务B、D可以继续执行
